title: 110_s439
content: The "Retired Pay Restoration Act of 2007" allows certain military retirees with service-connected disabilities to receive both retired pay and veterans' disability compensation. The Retired Pay Restoration Act of 2007 extends concurrent receipt authority to retirees with service-connected disabilities rated less than 50 percent and repeals the 50 percent requirement. It also repeals the phase-in of concurrent receipt for retirees with total service-connected disabilities. The Retired Pay Restoration Act of 2007 extends concurrent receipt authority to retirees with service-connected disabilities rated less than 50 percent and repeals the 50 percent requirement. It also repeals the phase-in of concurrent receipt for retirees with total service-connected disabilities. Section 1414 is amended to specify conditions for payment of retired pay to qualified retirees receiving veterans' disability compensation. Section 1414 of the Retired Pay Restoration Act of 2007 is amended to allow for concurrent payment of retired pay and disability compensation for eligible retirees. Section 1414 of the Retired Pay Restoration Act of 2007 is amended to allow for concurrent payment of retired pay and disability compensation for eligible retirees, effective January 1, 2008. This applies to payments starting from that date. Additionally, there is coordination of service eligibility for combat-related special compensation and concurrent receipt. Amendments are made to eligibility criteria for TERA retirees under section 1413a of title 10, United States Code. The changes include requirements for retired pay entitlement and combat-related disability. Additionally, standardization amendments are made to align similar provisions in the legislation. Amendments to eligibility criteria for TERA retirees under section 1413a of title 10, United States Code include defining a qualified retiree as a member entitled to retired pay with certain service requirements. The amendments made to section 1414 of title 10, United States Code, affect disability retirees by changing the rules for Chapter 61 disability retirees and removing paragraph (2). These changes will be effective from January 1, 2008, and apply to payments starting from that date.
